#Text=CHAPTER XIV
#Text=As I drove into the yard , a bare-headed old nigger with a game leg throwed down an armful of wood he was gathering and went limping up to the veranda as fast as he could .
#Text=He opened the door and bawled out , pointing to us , before he had it fairly open :
#Text=" O Marse WILLyum ! O Miss LUCY ! Dey 've brung him home ! DAR he !

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=A little , bright , black-eyed old lady like a wren comes running out of the house , and chirps :

#Text= O Bud --

_	_	_	_

#Text= I reckon not , Miss Lucy , " says Bud raising himself up on the mattress as she runs up to the wagon , and trying to act like everything was all a joke .

column1: #Text=She was jest high enough to kiss him over the edge of the wagon box .
#Text=A worried-looking old gentleman come out the door , seen Bud and his mother kissing each other , and then says to the old nigger man :
#Text=" George , yo ' old fool , what do yo ' mean by shouting out like that ?
#Text=" Shut up , " says the old gentleman , very quiet .
#Text=" Take the bay mare and go for Doctor Po'ter .

#Text= So they got yo ' , Bud ? Yo ' WOULD go nightriding like a rowdy and a thug ! Are yo ' much hurt ?

_	_	_	_

#Text=And the old lady , smiling and crying both to oncet , says ,  God bless her brave boy .

_	_	_	_

#Text=But the old gentleman looked mighty serious , and his worry settled into a frown between his eyes , and he turns to me and says :

#Text= Yo ' must pardon us , sir , fo ' neglecting to thank yo ' sooner .

column1: #Text=And they all had them easy-going , wait-a-bit kind of voices , and did n't see no pertic'ler importance in their " r 's .
#Text=The old man says the Ku Kluxes was working fur a principle -- the principle of keeping the white supremacy on top of the nigger race .
#Text=Fur if you let ' em quit work and go around balloting and voting it wo n't do .
#Text=It makes ' em biggity .
#Text=And a biggity nigger is laying up trouble fur himself .
#Text=Because sooner or later he will get to thinking he is as good as one of these here Angle-Saxtons you are always hearing so much talk about down South .
#Text=And if the Angle-Saxtons was to stand fur that , purty soon they would be sociable equality .
#Text=And next the hull dern country would be niggerized .

#Text=Them there Angle-Saxtons , that come over from Ireland and Scotland and France and the Great British Islands and settled up the South jest simply could n't afford to let that happen , he says , and so they Ku Kluxed the niggers to make ' em quit voting .
#Text=It was THEIR job to MAKE law and order , he says , which they could n't be with niggers getting the idea they had a right to govern .
#Text=So they Ku Kluxed ' em like gentlemen .
#Text=But these here night-riders , he says , is AGIN law and order -- they can shoot up more law and order in one night than can be manufactured agin in ten years .

#Text=He was a very quiet , peaceable old man , Mr. Davis was , and Bud says he was so dern foolish about law and order he had to up and shoot a man , about fifteen years ago , who hearn him talking that-a-way and said he reminded him of a Boston school teacher .
